why: Understanding catastrophizing helps you recognize when your thoughts are amplifying pain and how to manage them.

slides.title: Sticky Thoughts vs. Sticky Tissues
slides.content: Catastrophizing thoughts can make pain feel worse than the actual tissue damage

slides.title: What is Catastrophizing?
slides.content: Rumination on pain sensations, magnification of pain meaning, and helplessness about pain management

slides.title: The Impact
slides.content: Catastrophizing increases pain intensity, disability, and emotional distress; it's a stronger predictor than physical factors

slides.title: Breaking the Cycle
slides.content: CBT techniques like thought challenging, mindfulness, and activity pacing can reduce catastrophizing

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Pain is purely physical. Fact: Thoughts and emotions significantly influence pain perception.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: Notice when thoughts spiral; ask 'Is this thought helpful?' and gently redirect to present moment
